m6Tv7OCWCZlJ3gOaj.name: Easy to hit

tbB8FlaUVuRanGu-T.name: Absent-Mindedness

tEO6O06rHnIkHPOmM.name: Acrophobia (Heights)
tEO6O06rHnIkHPOmM.notes: You may not voluntarily go more than 15 feet above ground, unless you are inside a building and away from windows. If there is some chance of an actual fall, self-control rolls are at -5.

ma8nqeHzt2dW9hD09.name: Euphoria

taFPI7E0PJwXbS5nL.name: Agoraphobia (Open Spaces)
taFPI7E0PJwXbS5nL.notes: You are uncomfortable whenever you are outside, and actually become frightened when there are no walls within 50 feet.

tx8ZOfGNA3np_ivia.name: Aichmophobia/TL5- (Sharp Things)
tx8ZOfGNA3np_ivia.notes: You are afraid of anything pointed. Swords, spears, knives, and needles all give you fits. Trying to use a sharp weapon, or being threatened with one, requires a self-control roll at -2.

tcPz4czZWl6IBoVSi.name: Autophobia (Being Alone)
tcPz4czZWl6IBoVSi.notes: You cannot stand to be alone, and do anything in your power to avoid it.

tOIbA7bxjknhRjYSU.name: Bad Back
tOIbA7bxjknhRjYSU.notes: Throw out your back whenever you make a ST roll, and whenever you roll 17 or 18 on an attack or defense roll in melee combat, or on a roll for an “athletic” skill such as Acrobatics, make a HT roll as well

m_b1sKdEneDHsEQPe.notes: Almost everyone except @large class of people@

tELmv9bNG_8o75sYZ.name: Berserk

tzt3FQiPe2cmVzpVT.name: Brontophobia (Loud Noises)
tzt3FQiPe2cmVzpVT.notes: You avoid any situation where loud noises are likely. A sudden loud noise requires an immediate self-control roll. A thunderstorm is a traumatic experience for you!

tOyGCEEXkwH_ipfxg.name: Chronic Depression
tOyGCEEXkwH_ipfxg.notes: Make a self-control roll to do anything but acquire and consume the minimum necessities for survival, or whenever you must choose between two or more actions

to IQ-based skills when alone

mIon9praIhhmbapwo.name: Projection
mIon9praIhhmbapwo.notes: Can use abilities on material world

tWpr7NCMkHBwsQMNQ.name: Claustrophobia (Enclosed Spaces)
tWpr7NCMkHBwsQMNQ.notes: You are uncomfortable any time you can’t see the sky – or at least a very high ceiling. In a small room or vehicle, you feel the walls closing in on you... You need air! This is a dangerous fear for someone who plans to go underground.

features.situation: from members of your religion and those who respect your faith
from others aware of your clueless nature
to resist Sex Appeal

tHya0RG2_BqeqLArf.name: Code of Honor (Chivalry)
tHya0RG2_BqeqLArf.notes: Protect any lady, and anyone weaker than yourself. Never break your word. Never ignore an insult to yourself, a lady, your liege-lord, or your faith; insults may only be wiped out by an apology or a duel (not necessarily to the death!). Never take advantage of an opponent in any way; weapons and circumstances must be equal (even in open war if the foe is also noble and chivalrous). Accept any challenge to arms from anyone of greater or equal rank.

tEPlPRVY1z8clGFZ1.name: Code of Honor (Gentleman's)
tEPlPRVY1z8clGFZ1.notes: Never break your word. Never ignore an insult to yourself, a lady, or your flag; insults may only be wiped out by an apology or a duel (not necessarily to the death!). Never take advantage of an opponent in any way; weapons and circumstances must be equal (except in open war). This only applies between gentlemen.

tqq24I9NJrLajsURv.name: Code of Honor (Pirate's)
tqq24I9NJrLajsURv.notes: Always avenge an insult, regardless of the danger; your buddy’s foe is your own; never attack a fellow crewman or buddy except in a fair, open duel.

tW3e4OJTtFNNveAgo.name: Code of Honor (Professional)
tW3e4OJTtFNNveAgo.notes: Adhere to the ethics of your profession; always do your job to the best of your ability; support your guild, union, or professional association.

txSrmgLB0M36uR802.name: Code of Honor (Soldier's)
txSrmgLB0M36uR802.notes: An officer should be tough but fair, lead from the front, and look out for his men; an enlisted man should look out for his buddies and take care of his kit. Every soldier should be willing to fight and die for the honor of his unit, service, and country; follow orders; obey the “rules of war”; treat an honorable enemy with respect (a dishonorable enemy deserves a bullet); and wear the uniform with pride.

tByWkjvIB0UzQSz5Q.name: Coitophobia (Sex)
tByWkjvIB0UzQSz5Q.notes: You are terrified by the idea of sexual relations or the loss of your virginity.

features.situation: to HT to resist the effects of temperature
to HT to resist the effects of temperature

trdRnHewvO9QjUZDJ.name: Combat Paralysis
trdRnHewvO9QjUZDJ.notes: In any situation in which personal harm seems imminent, make a HT roll. Do not roll until the instant you need to fight, run, pull the trigger, or whatever. Any roll over 13 is a failure, even if you have HT 14+. On a success, you can act normally. On a failure, you are mentally stunned.

features.situation: on all IQ rolls to wake up or to recover from surprise or mental stun
to initiative rolls for your side (+2 if you are the leader)

from pious folk

tBo2ze1N-AhjfZpqW.name: Confused

tIixiOHEen0Uqu4Xo.name: Constriction Attack
tIixiOHEen0Uqu4Xo.notes: If you succeed on a grapple against an opponent no larger than your own SM, on your next turn, and each successive turn, roll a Quick Contest of your ST vs. your victim’s ST or HT, whichever is higher. If you win, your victim takes damage equal to your margin of victory; otherwise, no damage is inflicted

mBqxK-mv1FutR34ob.name: Can obtain information using supernatural talents

tsHSzoJhgVSPSXqNY.name: Cowardice

mY3BablhCVGozM1VO.name: Can see colors in the dark

tXFf9MSQ3FMT2psO8.notes: Any group of over a dozen people sets off this fear unless they are all well known to you. The self-control roll is at -1 for over 25 people, -2 for a crowd of 100 or more, -3 for 1,000, -4 for 10,000, and so on.

mTJMFiiP0nwitmckL.name: Frequency: Constantly

mavJTY5ktGlKgNSF2.name: Frequency: Monthly

mpJvpvAirvQwGrM2d.name: Frequency: Seasonally

mA1sDxov2lOPDJbMK.name: Frequency: Yearly

mwEEsdBfFfNCdaRqZ.name: Aging

to your side on initiative rolls (+2 if you're the leader)

tTeeNp4aWCjsLvUGJ.name: Entomophobia (Insects)
tTeeNp4aWCjsLvUGJ.notes: You are afraid of all “bugs.” Large or poisonous ones give -3 to self-control rolls. Very large ones, or large numbers, give -6. Avoid hills of giant ants.

tI76H2W3gXER916--.name: Epilepsy
tI76H2W3gXER916--.notes: Make a HT roll whenever you are in a stressful situation (especially if your life or the life of a friend is threatened). If you have any sort of Phobia, exposure to the object of your fear counts as a stressful situation; roll vs. HT once every 10 minutes. On a failure, you suffer a seizure that lasts 1d minutes and costs you 1d FP. You can do nothing during that time.

tijmxMEy4B1uAVMr9.name: Extra Sleep
tijmxMEy4B1uAVMr9.notes: Require 1 hour/level more sleep for a full night's rest (max 4)

tpqxCsRu8W1w0NZPS.name: Extraordinary Luck
tpqxCsRu8W1w0NZPS.notes: Usable once per 30 minutes of play

m-pdnEt9Bqj6y2sD8.name: Game Time
m-pdnEt9Bqj6y2sD8.notes: Uses per game day equal to its maximum possible uses per real hour

to someone else's reaction bonus from others when you put together their outfit
to ST vs knockback

toTe273Ky82B6YdW5.name: Fit
toTe273Ky82B6YdW5.notes: Recover FP at twice the normal rate (but not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

features.situation: to all HT rolls to stay conscious, avoid death, resist disease, or resist poison

tzk8xRWG-00Yzdsjm.name: Flashbacks
tzk8xRWG-00Yzdsjm.notes: In any situation that the GM feels is stressful, he will roll 3d. On a 6 or less, you have a flashback. The GM will roll whenever you miss a Fright Check or make the roll exactly, and whenever you fail a self-control roll for another stress-related disadvantage.

m1aG4V_cTCNVJRjBG.name: Mild
m1aG4V_cTCNVJRjBG.notes: Duration: 2d seconds; -2 on all skill rolls

m8zJsu3Lp8c9kb9pe.name: Severe

mMZ4cNLmoamGpBMkX.name: Crippling

mXMFn4TQMAKHrlx-P.name: Encumbrance-Limited (No encumbrance)
mXMFn4TQMAKHrlx-P.notes: Can only glide at best when overburdened

me4cEfZshUjmsAH2M.name: Encumbrance-Limited (Light encumbrance)

tYHaB3nA17KP6h1DZ.name: Gluttony
tYHaB3nA17KP6h1DZ.notes: Make a self-control roll when presented with a tempting morsel or good wine that, for some reason, you should resist. If you fail, you partake – regardless of the consequences.

mUaZiminB4CaSIofF.name: People Affected
mUaZiminB4CaSIofF.notes: Almost everyone except @large class of people@

features.situation: from others aware of your reputation

tvF5dIQf3Jrwb_KXv.name: Greed
tvF5dIQf3Jrwb_KXv.notes: Make a self-control roll any time riches are offered – as payment for fair work, gains from adventure, spoils of crime, or just bait. If you fail, you do whatever it takes to get the payoff.

to HT rolls made for survival at -HP or below, and on any HT roll where failure means instant death. If this bonus makes the difference between success and failure, you collapse, apparently dead (or disabled), but come to in the usual amount of time. A successful Diagnosis roll reveals the truth.
to any HT roll to avoid unconsciousness

thCOpfb0WhIRApB_x.name: Hemophilia
thCOpfb0WhIRApB_x.notes: Any untreated wound bleeds at a rate equal to its original damage every minute

tCEOuCUPPWTbOE7ei.name: Hemophobia (Blood)
tCEOuCUPPWTbOE7ei.notes: The sight of blood gives you the screaming willies! You need to make a self-control roll during most combats...

t4wDTpXzFtP1yT7BF.name: Heroic Feats of @One of Strength, Dexterity, or Health@
t4wDTpXzFtP1yT7BF.notes: Once per game session, you may add 1d to @One of Strength, Dexterity, or Health@, which lasts 3d seconds

tToKVITWIFSZIRkXK.name: Herpetophobia (Reptiles)
tToKVITWIFSZIRkXK.notes: You come unglued at the thought of reptiles, amphibians, and similar scaly slimies. A very large reptile, or a poisonous one, gives -2 to self-control rolls; a horde of reptiles (such as a snake pit) gives -4.

features.situation: on any task that requires creativity or invention, including most rolls against Artist skill, all Engineer rolls for new inventions, and all skill rolls made to use the Gadgeteer advantage

teRggYn926_I1YeWO.name: High Pain Threshold
teRggYn926_I1YeWO.notes: Never suffer shock penalties when injured

t7pCgXTVkswkTjOZO.name: Honesty
t7pCgXTVkswkTjOZO.notes: Make a self-control roll when faced with the “need” to break unreasonable laws; if you fail, you must obey the law, whatever the consequences. If you manage to resist your urges and break the law, make a second self-control roll afterward. If you fail, you must turn yourself in to the authorities!

tmQosgh6KoBoBDxMb.name: Hoplophobia (Weapons)
tmQosgh6KoBoBDxMb.notes: The presence of any sort of weaponry is stressful. Trying to use a weapon, or being threatened with one, requires a self-control roll at -2.

features.situation: added to any penalties assessed for excessive drinking the previous evening and add 3 hours to hangover duration

mxbtdfFSJn8FxVfV5.name: DX penalty if not wearing custom-made clothing and armor
mxbtdfFSJn8FxVfV5.notes: Clothing and armor costs 10% more than usual

spot hidden clues or objects with Forensics, Observation or Search

tV06LED8bg9xJGF3c.name: Impulsiveness

t5NruiJFzLvsyzwd1.name: Incompetence (@Skill@)

tM8LVZ-8-HpvEFsPi.name: Incurious

tGc0aok6RyP6uSDca.name: Indecisive
tGc0aok6RyP6uSDca.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever a choice confronts you, modified downward by 1 for each alternative you can see. If you fail, you do nothing.

t4ANWaWCephx_yJpO.name: Indomitable
t4ANWaWCephx_yJpO.notes: Impossible to influence through ordinary words or actions

mmNNvnxjiTDKejRV0.name: Diffuse
mmNNvnxjiTDKejRV0.notes: Immune to crippling injuries. Brain, Vitals and Groin cannot be targeted. Most foes cannot slam or grapple you (GM's decision). Do not bleed. Unaffected by blood-borne toxins. Immune to attacks that rely on cutting off blood to part of your body. Impaling and piercing attacks of any size never do more than 1 HP of injury, regardless of penetrating damage. Other attacks never do more than 2 HP of injury. Exception: Area-effect, cone, and explosion attacks cause normal injury

mWZ94aEkMmxYd7uwx.name: Homogenous
mWZ94aEkMmxYd7uwx.notes: Altered wound modifiers: imp & pi++ are x1/2, pi+ is x1/3, pi is x1/5, pi- is x1/10

mZ-8mAvSedu_8pE2g.name: No Blood
mZ-8mAvSedu_8pE2g.notes: Do not bleed, unaffected by blood-borne toxins, immune to attacks that rely on cutting off blood to part of your body

m4FpkRC4mwdINUEb8.name: No Brain
m4FpkRC4mwdINUEb8.notes: Brain cannot be targeted. Blows to the skull or eye are treated like blows to the face, except that eye injury can still cripple the eye

mF1qlLiqK-HknBCuA.name: No Eyes
mF1qlLiqK-HknBCuA.notes: Eyes may not be targeted. Immune to blinding attacks

mQjR2rKbqgEiudNrT.name: No Head
mQjR2rKbqgEiudNrT.notes: Skull, Brain and Face cannot be targeted

mtsIOxcys2ZhIAAJ2.name: No Neck
mtsIOxcys2ZhIAAJ2.notes: Neck may not be targeted and cannot be decapitated, choked or strangled

mZxRSOGVZMQERE3K5.name: No Vitals
mZxRSOGVZMQERE3K5.notes: Attacks to the Vitals or Groin are treated as attacks to the Torso

m_m2GNV0JSNZjPj-C.name: Unliving
m_m2GNV0JSNZjPj-C.notes: Altered wound modifiers: imp & pi++ are x1, pi+ is x1/2, pi is x1/3, pi- is x1/5

features.situation: to rolls to notice you've been cheated by dishonest merchants

mfhiYR3-PHPGQLLLy.name: Mild
mfhiYR3-PHPGQLLLy.notes: GM secretly rolls 3d for the number of days between episodes

mFZspensKBOhSTvCr.name: Severe
mFZspensKBOhSTvCr.notes: GM secretly rolls 2d-1 for the number of days between episodes

mAu17jEEQP_7yDCWE.name: Partial Change
mAu17jEEQP_7yDCWE.notes: Can turn an item you are carrying substantial without dropping it

ttHkLI9zwzfeOIEZc.name: Intolerance (@Class, Ethnicity, Nationality, Religion, Sex, or Species@)

features.situation: from victims of your intolerance (may be as much as -5, at GM's discretion)

mmDRFNiSG6SuC5nvM.name: Usually On
mmDRFNiSG6SuC5nvM.notes: Turning visible costs 1 FP per second

features.situation: toward those you are jealous of (may be as much as -4, at GM's discretion)
(up to -3, at GM's discretion) from others in any situation where your lack of appreciation becomes obvious (GM’s decision)

tG1q2hcai2DaeRlhm.name: Kleptomania
tG1q2hcai2DaeRlhm.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you are presented with a chance to steal, at up to -3 if the item is especially interesting to you (not necessarily valuable, unless you are poor or have Greed). If you fail, you must try to steal it. You may keep or sell stolen items, but you may not return or discard them.

tWxf5xaLhR2u0HTIG.name: Lame (Crippled Legs)
tWxf5xaLhR2u0HTIG.notes: You must reduce your Basic Move to half your Basic Speed (round down)

features.situation: to use any skill that requires the use of your legs, including all Melee Weapon and unarmed combat skills (but not ranged combat skills)

t913yYdCVbggpDJhW.name: Lame (Legless)
t913yYdCVbggpDJhW.notes: You cannot stand, kick, or walk at all and must reduce Basic Move to 0.

features.situation: to use any skill that requires the use of your legs, including all Melee Weapon and unarmed combat skills (but not ranged combat skills)

tdHCO1x1tJFdvEQfY.name: Lame (Missing Legs)
tdHCO1x1tJFdvEQfY.notes: Using crutches or a peg leg, you can stand up and walk slowly. You must reduce Basic Move to 2.

features.situation: to use any skill that requires the use of your legs, including all Melee Weapon and unarmed combat skills (but not ranged combat skills)

t_BtPkfku8hF5OeUx.name: Lame (Paraplegic)
t_BtPkfku8hF5OeUx.notes: You cannot stand, kick, or walk at all and must reduce Basic Move to 0.

features.situation: to use any skill that requires the use of your legs, including all Melee Weapon and unarmed combat skills (but not ranged combat skills)

t8qGWt5QTFIvrpyKT.name: Laziness
t8qGWt5QTFIvrpyKT.notes: Your chances of getting a raise or promotion in any job are halved. If you are self-employed, halve your monthly pay.

tSiOKuvTJkqJhuRrI.name: Lecherousness
tSiOKuvTJkqJhuRrI.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you have more than the briefest contact with an appealing member of the sex you find attractive, at -5 if this person is Handsome/Beautiful, or at -10 if Very Handsome/Very Beautiful. If you fail, you must make a “pass” using whatever wiles and skills you can bring to bear.

tMxgHfzVEy_QQtlfB.name: Less Sleep
tMxgHfzVEy_QQtlfB.notes: Require 1 hour/level less sleep for a full night's rest (max 4)

mks4YDp8Kbv2-n6Yo.name: Know Your Own Strength Variant Price

tOW5XqmChX0NBm1AP.name: Light Sleeper
tOW5XqmChX0NBm1AP.notes: Whenever you must sleep in an uncomfortable place, or whenever there is more than the slightest noise, you must make a HT roll in order to fall asleep. On a failure, you can try again after one hour, but you will suffer all the usual effects of one hour of missed sleep.

tnD52D6dhwXRMkPs5.name: Loner
tnD52D6dhwXRMkPs5.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever anyone lingers nearby, watches over your shoulder, etc. If you fail, you lash out at that person just as if you had Bad Temper.

thdJ55ghf__io9AQa.name: Longevity
thdJ55ghf__io9AQa.notes: You fail aging rolls only on a 17 or 18, or only on an 18 if your modified HT is 17 or better

tQsgCJSqiGP4g4fkG.name: Low Pain Threshold
tQsgCJSqiGP4g4fkG.notes: Double the shock from any injury. Whenever you take a wound that does more than 1 HP of damage, you must make a Will roll to avoid crying out.

features.situation: from "macho" individuals
to resist knockdown, stunning, and physical torture
to all skill rolls whenever you believe that the odds are against you or others expect you to fail (GM’s judgment)

tz-USDL9B_KrrVqDi.name: Luck
tz-USDL9B_KrrVqDi.notes: Usable once per hour of play

mhpGReLpFgqzLkyww.name: Game Time
mhpGReLpFgqzLkyww.notes: Uses per game day equal to its maximum possible uses per real hour

tDaEF7zyuUsXy-UQ2.name: Lunacy
tDaEF7zyuUsXy-UQ2.notes: During the full moon, you are extremely emotional and volatile, while on nights of the new moon you are very passive (you temporarily suffer from the Laziness disadvantage, B142). While the moon is waxing, you are focused and pleasant; while it is waning, you are apathetic and a little touchy.

features.situation: to all Will and self-control rolls during the full moon
to resist spells
to skill for others to cast a spell on you
to skill for others to cast a spell on you
to resist spells

mrRB4A19so8sIZZpW.name: Frequency: Three to five times daily

t7FAtBhwvCq8nqY2T.name: Manaphobia (Magic)
t7FAtBhwvCq8nqY2T.notes: You can never learn to use magic, and you react badly to any user of magic. Make a self-control roll whenever you are in the presence of magic. This roll is at -3 if you are to be the target of friendly magic, and -6 if you are the target of hostile magic. (The magic does not have to be real, if you believe in it!)

t8YOwR79EMqe7fPGC.name: Manic-Depressive
t8YOwR79EMqe7fPGC.notes: At the beginning of each play session, roll 1d. On 1-3, you are in your manic phase; 4-6 indicates depression. Every five hours of game time thereafter, roll 3d. A 10 or less indicates that you begin a mood swing. Over the next hour, you shift from your current phase to the opposite one. You remain in the new phase for at least five hours, after which you must again roll 3d.

tfujsOp4WL4ZholTv.name: Mild Shyness
tfujsOp4WL4ZholTv.notes: You are uneasy with strangers, especially assertive or attractive ones.

features.situation: to attribute, skill, or reaction rolls, as appropriate, in situations where Minor Handicap (@Body Part@) would logically interfere

tj2zJQBTiP1QtLdMy.name: Miserliness
tj2zJQBTiP1QtLdMy.notes: Make a self-control roll any time you are called on to spend money. If the expenditure is large, this roll may be at -5 or worse (GM’s decision). If you fail, you refuse to spend the money.

m-Ogl4pBipgr65-3G.name: Focus-Limited (@Any ordinary variety of matter or energy@)

mRW1bj7fLZk4N5p94.name: Focus-Limited (@Any ordinary variety of matter or energy@)

m9kkykrC8KVeE9ujx.name: Focus-Limited (@Any ordinary variety of matter or energy@)

miMro06HjanfrNVPT.name: Focus-Limited (@Any ordinary variety of matter or energy@)

tOMQxw182b4b2dicl.name: Motion Sickness
tOMQxw182b4b2dicl.notes: You may never learn any vehicle-operation skill. You must roll vs. HT as soon as you are aboard a moving vehicle. On a failure, you vomit and are at -5 on all DX, IQ, and skill rolls for the rest of the journey. On a success, you are merely miserably queasy and at -2 on DX, IQ, and skill rolls. Roll daily on long journeys.

tYggvuZw_KmnKdpZ0.name: Mysophobia (Dirt)
tYggvuZw_KmnKdpZ0.notes: You are deathly afraid of infection, or just of dirt and filth. Make a self-control roll when you must do something that might get you dirty. Roll at -5 to eat any unaccustomed food. You should act as “finicky” as possible.

tIWYdBAI7sQ-IyQE7.name: Necrophobia (Death)
tIWYdBAI7sQ-IyQE7.notes: You are terrified by the idea of death. Make a self-control roll in the presence of any dead body (animals don’t count, but portions of human bodies do). Roll at -4 if the body is that of someone you know, or -6 if the body is unnaturally animated in some way. A ghost (or apparent ghost) also requires a roll at -6.

features.situation: to HT rolls to avoid illness brought on by rich or spicy food, strong drink, etc.
to all HT rolls concerned with eye damage

t2KMOQYYPIHD_5HTz.name: Night Blindness
t2KMOQYYPIHD_5HTz.notes: If the vision or combat penalty for poor lighting is between -1 and -4 for most people, your penalty is the worse of double the usual penalty or -3. If the usual penalty is -5 or worse, you function as though you were completely blind. If you have Acute Vision, it only applies in situations with no darkness penalty.

tzWQ90ARlX5DcAAu7.name: Nightmares
tzWQ90ARlX5DcAAu7.notes: Make a self-control roll each morning upon awakening. If you fail, you suffered nightmares; this costs you 1 FP that you can only recover through sleep. On a roll of 17 or 18, you are left shaking, and are at -1 to all skill and Perception rolls for the entire day.

features.situation: to DX in combat and on any task involving hand-eye coordination
on ranged attacks (unless you Aim first) and on rolls to operate any vehicle faster than a horse and buggy

t5IOcaWGg4has8rt_.name: No Peripheral Vision
t5IOcaWGg4has8rt_.notes: Your arc of vision is a 120° wedge to the front. On a map, your “left” and “right” hexes become “back” hexes – that is, you have three “back” hexes, and get no defense against attacks originating from these hexes!

features.situation: from others in any situation where No Sense of Humor becomes evident
to resist Influence skills: Diplomacy, Fast-Talk, Intimidation, Savoir-Faire, Sex Appeal, and Streetwise

tuBvIPa1ygEAxIiQ2.name: Obsession
tuBvIPa1ygEAxIiQ2.notes: @Goal@; Make a self-control roll whenever it would be wise to deviate from your goal. If you fail, you continue to pursue your Obsession, regardless of the consequences.

td7zQlyInlQxbhJsD.name: On the Edge
td7zQlyInlQxbhJsD.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you face a life-threatening situation: piloting a burning vehicle, staring down an entire street gang while armed only with a toothbrush, etc. If you fail, you may not back down from the challenge – but you may roll again after every success roll or reaction roll relating to the situation. In combat, make a self-control roll every time you take your turn. If you fail, you must make an All-Out attack or engage in some other kind of near-insane, suicidal behavior.

features.situation: from others if they witness your On the Edge behavior, unless it is someone who values bravery over self-preservation (GM’s decision), who will react at +2 instead

todj00Fu5MUtTPuJt.name: One Arm
todj00Fu5MUtTPuJt.notes: You cannot use two-handed weapons, wield two weapons at once (or a weapon and a shield), or perform any task that requires two arms

features.situation: on tasks that are possible with one arm but that are usually executed with two
to DX in combat and on any task involving hand-eye coordination
on ranged attacks (unless you Aim first) and on rolls to operate any vehicle faster than a horse and buggy

tbRf_88KHN922paNz.name: One Hand
tbRf_88KHN922paNz.notes: You cannot use two-handed weapons, wield two weapons at once (or a weapon and a shield), or perform any task that requires two arms

features.situation: on tasks that are possible with one arm but that are usually executed with two

tPbL1_rekOzkM86wz.name: Overconfidence
tPbL1_rekOzkM86wz.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are
from experienced NPCs
to ST vs. knockback

th9TK1Jmqg8uKe6SC.name: Pacifism: Cannot Harm Innocents
th9TK1Jmqg8uKe6SC.notes: You may fight – you may even start fights – but you may only use deadly force on a foe that is attempting to do you serious harm. Capture is not “serious harm” unless you are already under penalty of death or have a Code of Honor that would require suicide if captured. You never intentionally do anything that causes, or even threatens to cause, injury to the uninvolved – particularly if they are “ordinary folks.”

tUl2tCfZVgRF9QWYx.name: Pacifism: Cannot Kill
tUl2tCfZVgRF9QWYx.notes: You may fight – you may even start fights – but you may never do anything that seems likely to kill another. This includes abandoning a wounded foe to die “on his own”! You must do your best to keep your companions from killing, too. If you do kill someone (or feel responsible for a death), you immediately suffer a nervous breakdown. Roll 3d and be totally morose and useless for that many days. During this time, you must make a Will roll to offer any sort of violence toward anyone, for any reason.

tV_f_75HmwzWOPhuu.name: Pacifism: Reluctant Killer
tV_f_75HmwzWOPhuu.notes: You are psychologically unprepared to kill people. Whenever you make a deadly attack (e.g., with a knife or a gun) against an obvious person whose face is visible to you, you are at -4 to hit and may not Aim. If you cannot see the foe’s face (due to a mask, darkness, or distance, or because you attacked from behind), the penalty is only -2, save in close combat. You have no penalty to attack a vehicle (even an occupied one), an opponent you do not believe is a person (including things with Horrific or Monstrous appearance), or a target you can’t actually see (e.g., a set of map coordinates or a blip on a radar screen). If you kill a recognizable person, the effect on you is the same as for Pacifism: Cannot Kill. You have no problem with your allies killing; you may even supply ammo, loaded weapons, and encouragement! You just can’t do the killing yourself.

thSMVzJ590v7gAD8d.name: Pacifism: Self-Defense Only
thSMVzJ590v7gAD8d.notes: You only fight to defend yourself or those in your care, using only as much force as necessary (no pre-emptive strikes allowed!). You must do your best to discourage others from starting fights.

t2lEvLuiVboewGE6k.name: Pacifism: Total Nonviolence
t2lEvLuiVboewGE6k.notes: You will not lift a hand against another intelligent creature, for any reason. You must do your nonviolent best to discourage violent behavior in others, too. You are free to defend yourself against attacks by animals, mosquitoes, etc.

features.situation: from others
toward any stranger and any “legitimate” reaction penalty (e.g., for an unfriendly race or nationality) is doubled

mEBJqylRdwS2F76ux.name: @Who: Individual with 150% of PC's starting points@

maT7M7DB1NIFxeDja.name: @Who: Organization with assets of at least 1000 times starting wealth@

mcVBhnAUL_PZkepSf.name: @Who: Individual with twice the PC's starting points@

mFbwprALUgwrOjDJ8.name: @Who: Organization with assets of at least 10000 times starting wealth@

mRIDtw4Y8zEt222S5.name: @Who: Organization with assets of at least 100000 times starting wealth@

m0ZpmSBlRiD8RBt7-.name: @Who: Organization with assets of at least 1000000 times starting wealth@

mQSaPcJCdJuA11m2z.name: @Who: A national government or giant multi-national organization@

mzpzi3iMtyaIvX7oI.name: Equipment
mzpzi3iMtyaIvX7oI.notes: @Equipment worth no more than average starting wealth@

mOujIwfCrJXSZacVv.name: Equipment
mOujIwfCrJXSZacVv.notes: @Equipment worth more than average starting wealth@

mSrmRLTPosOvFYkqR.name: Special Abilities
mSrmRLTPosOvFYkqR.notes: @Magical powers in a non-magical world, higher TL equipment, grants special powers or is supernatural@

features.situation: to others' Hearing roll in siturations where you want to be heard over noise
on DX and DX-based skill rolls to keep your feet or avoid being knocked down in combat
on all rolls to keep your feet if the surface is wet, slippery or unstable

mMUCGNDyQuNBt1pzG.name: Easy to Hit
mMUCGNDyQuNBt1pzG.notes: Others can target your eyes at only -6 to hit

mt9Y3edU35a_e_HvF.name: @Very Common Substance: Earth, Metal, Stone, Wood, etc.@

mCES_UacySTL5_nnm.name: @Occasional Substance: Glass, Ice, Sand, Aluminum, Copper, etc.@

tkH3Z500lfDbdUbtv.name: Phantom Voices
tkH3Z500lfDbdUbtv.notes: In any situation that the GM feels is stressful, he may roll 3d. On a 6 or less, you hear voices. The GM will always roll whenever you miss a Fright Check or make the roll exactly, and whenever you fail a self-control roll for another stress-related disadvantage.

features.situation: from those who consider you to be in a position of helplessness, weakness, or need (which never includes those with the Callous disadvantage)

tcLpFfSmbHHdHy5Yd.name: Post-Combat Shakes
tcLpFfSmbHHdHy5Yd.notes: Make a self-control roll at the end of any battle. If you fail, roll 3d, add the amount by which you failed your self-control roll, and look up the result on the Fright Check Table.

m3B8IXjC95fGn6VDr.name: Dreaming
m3B8IXjC95fGn6VDr.notes: Combined with Active Only or Can't See Own Death

features.situation: to orders, insults, or social slights

tFfzQ6ETSImJHHvkX.name: Pyromania
tFfzQ6ETSImJHHvkX.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you have an opportunity to set a fire

tK3S6AFjeQgu4gPRi.name: Pyrophobia (Fire)
tK3S6AFjeQgu4gPRi.notes: Even a burning cigarette bothers you if it comes within five yards.

tpwIBKlkbnSdcNrWd.name: Racial Skill Bonus - @Skill without a specialization@

features.situation: to your effective HT whenever you roll to recover lost HP or to see if you can get over a crippling injury

tfn3e0qr_rzjWJ1XH.name: Recovery
tfn3e0qr_rzjWJ1XH.notes: When determining the length of time you remain unconscious for any reason, divide all times by 60

mwrT9N1v1hBCk-C4B.name: @Rare: Acceleration, Altitude Sickness, Bends, Seasickness, Space Sickness, Nanomachines, etc.@

mrAskBA4fL3noeEyO.name: +8 to all HT rolls to resist

mM9ODq9EsPHF6Xd-3.name: +3 to all HT rolls to resist

tzcAVOHp3Wd0BY361.name: Ridiculous Luck
tzcAVOHp3Wd0BY361.notes: Usable once per 10 minutes of play

mkXAjmLlsYArLa-IN.name: Game Time
mkXAjmLlsYArLa-IN.notes: Uses per game day equal to its maximum possible uses per real hour

tknKLIc0OqWueFpSw.name: Sadism
tknKLIc0OqWueFpSw.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you have an opportunity to indulge your desires and know you shouldn’t (e.g., because the prisoner is one who should be released unharmed). If you fail, you cannot restrain yourself.

features.situation: from those who become aware of your Sadism unless they are from a culture that holds life in little esteem
from others in close confines
to attempts to track you by scent

txLXo2_xfezKSblJZ.name: Scotophobia (Darkness)
txLXo2_xfezKSblJZ.notes: A common fear, but crippling. You should avoid being underground if possible; if something happens to your flashlight or torch, you might well lose your mind before you can relight it.

m31y6_H_kHiP35PI9.name: Narrow Clearance on a "Need to Know" Basis

mFw6b4jGvuGKx21bl.name: Broad Clearance on a "Need to Know" Basis

tYdqy1uPSGI8VqvLV.name: Selfish
tYdqy1uPSGI8VqvLV.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you experience a clear social slight or “snub.” On a failure, you lash out at the offending party just as if you had Bad Temper.

features.situation: from others when your Selfishness surfaces

tw81RysAzky-yjNYN.name: Selfless
tw81RysAzky-yjNYN.notes: You must make a self-control roll to put your needs – even survival – before those of someone else.

t5QyTSiaUXedVNOuB.name: Semi-Upright
t5QyTSiaUXedVNOuB.notes: Moving while upright reduces Move by 40%

m1jM4iiI8x_bPodXf.name: Game Time
m1jM4iiI8x_bPodXf.notes: Uses per game week equal to its maximum possible uses per session

tq7qfCbN7ebIfT6-0.name: Severe Shyness
tq7qfCbN7ebIfT6-0.notes: You are very uncomfortable around strangers, and tend to be quiet even among friends.

mfcKqGHDzYiGkB9r_.name: Flawed
mfcKqGHDzYiGkB9r_.notes: Only for Morph. Flawed is mutually incompatible with Cosmetic.

mdyaN0YM7CwjGG72M.name: Needs Sample
mdyaN0YM7CwjGG72M.notes: Only for Morph. You must touch the target.

mi0npkqP6UJ4RYuD0.name: Needs Sample
mi0npkqP6UJ4RYuD0.notes: Only for Morph. You must obtain a drop of blood, hair sample, etc. from the target.

mv6HxRj_vkveHVmnj.name: Needs Sample
mv6HxRj_vkveHVmnj.notes: Only for Morph. You must eat the entire target.

tKw6h1n96MbPXiclO.name: Short Attention Span
tKw6h1n96MbPXiclO.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you must maintain interest in something for an extended period of time, or whenever a distraction is offered. If you fail, you automatically fail at the task at hand.

thKwCUUe961nSwzVi.name: Signature Gear
thKwCUUe961nSwzVi.notes: For equipment normally bought with money, each point gives goods worth up to 50% of the average campaign starting wealth (but never cash).

txsoBf4CKtgpHPkPK.name: Silence
txsoBf4CKtgpHPkPK.notes: Bonuses help only when hearing is the only sense that can be used to detect you.

features.situation: to Stealth when you are perfectly motionless
to Stealth if moving (even in armor, etc.)
to rolls for any lengthy mental task you concentrate on to the exclusion of other activities, if the GM feels such focus would be beneficial
to all rolls to notice interruptions while obsessed with a task
to ST vs. knockback

t8-YSePGPs_neBmGy.name: Sleepwalker
t8-YSePGPs_neBmGy.notes: If sleepwalking would matter during an adventure, the GM will make a self-control roll for you whenever you go to sleep. If you fail, you sleepwalk sometime during the night. You wake up after walking for 1d minutes, or if someone awakens you.

teXHpDmoSZB1Wbkzp.name: Slow Eater
teXHpDmoSZB1Wbkzp.notes: Each meal takes about two hours, as opposed to about ½ hour for most humans. This reduces the time available for study, long tasks, and travel on foot by 4½ hours per day.

features.situation: on all self-control rolls one hour after you awaken from any sleep longer than a one-hour nap
to IQ and IQ-based skills one hour after you awaken from any sleep longer than a one-hour nap
additional penalty whenever the GM assesses attribute penalties for missed sleep

tI6dwoBoTEQ-gfy0a.name: Social Chameleon
tI6dwoBoTEQ-gfy0a.notes: Exempt from reaction penalties due to differences in Rank or Status

features.situation: from those who demand respect in situations where there would be no penalties due to differences in Rank or Status

tzEXfvFpH9GIhQHJd.name: Social Disease
tzEXfvFpH9GIhQHJd.notes: Those who know about it automatically resist your seduction attempts

features.situation: from those who know about your Social Disease
from those who hold you in high regard for being a @Reason@, in a @Type: Feared, Respected or Venerated@ way.

m1qBM9x_PEavPrf98.name: Obvious from your appearance, dress or manner

features.situation: from anyone who sees you
from anyone who hears you speak

mGWOQXKSuMPA_MG9Q.name: Easily learned by anyone who cares to check up on you

features.situation: from anyone who cares to check up on you
from everryone you meet
from non-criminals who learn of your Criminal Record. Police, judges, vigilantes, and other law-and-order types react at -2
from others
from others
from others following your faith
from others
from others

tetv_QHXXaJpFToiz.name: Social Stigma (Minor)
tetv_QHXXaJpFToiz.notes: You are underage by your culture’s standards. You must buy off this trait when you reach “legal age” (usually 18) for your time and place.

features.situation: from others whenever you try to deal with them as an adult; they might like you, but they do not fully respect you

tCidFlSADk-zraK1o.name: Social Stigma (Minority Group)
tCidFlSADk-zraK1o.notes: You are a member of a minority that the dominant culture around you regards as “barbarians” or “inferior.”

features.situation: from others except your own kind
from others of your own kind in an area, profession, or situation where your minority is especially rare
from others

tkchRxKpwct0fHH7U.name: Social Stigma (Second-Class Citizen)
tkchRxKpwct0fHH7U.notes: You belong to a group that receives fewer rights and privileges than “full citizens.”

features.situation: from others except those of your own kind
from others
from others

t3qytj5PflAhy0bD7.name: Super Luck
t3qytj5PflAhy0bD7.notes: Dictate one die roll once per hour of play

mS5kKngzqla1kY6oz.notes: Uses per game day equal to its maximum possible uses per real hour

mnPE594NZwBxI_zAA.name: No Body Heat
mnPE594NZwBxI_zAA.notes: Gives +1 on all rolls to deduce your secret

features.situation: from those who touch you, shake your hand, kiss you, etc.

msfBWIZlb5F98mDeY.name: No Body Heat
msfBWIZlb5F98mDeY.notes: Can gain warmth temporarily, such as after feeding for a vampire. Gives +1 on all rolls to deduce your secret

features.situation: from those who touch you, shake your hand, kiss you, etc.

mLflNPSEZFbpT3LFc.name: No Reflection
mLflNPSEZFbpT3LFc.notes: Gives +2 on all rolls to deduce your secret

features.situation: from others who notice you have no reflection

mNVIY6vcZu498O78E.name: No Shadow
mNVIY6vcZu498O78E.notes: Gives +2 on all rolls to deduce your secret

features.situation: from others that notice you have no shadow

m_TpkVT3bdEc2AuGv.name: Pallor
m_TpkVT3bdEc2AuGv.notes: Gives +2 on all rolls to deduce your secret

features.situation: from others who can see you without makeup in good light

mEquPGHuiQmsxp3R1.name: Pallor
mEquPGHuiQmsxp3R1.notes: Can gain the flush of life temporarily, such as after feeding for a vampire. Gives +2 on all rolls to deduce your secret

features.situation: from others who can see you without makeup in good light

mWYo3hbFoI9bkyx78.name: Alternate Benefit
mWYo3hbFoI9bkyx78.notes: Bonus to rolls to survive made by plants in your care.

features.situation: from gardeners and sentient plants

mMicMurY_HnqFZdE_.name: Alternate Benefit
mMicMurY_HnqFZdE_.notes: Bonus to HT rolls for a specific patient and condition if treated full time.

features.situation: from patients

mch_3_vHUPybtgALY.name: Alternate Benefit
mch_3_vHUPybtgALY.notes: Bonus to HT rolls for a specific patient and condition if treated full time.

features.situation: from patients

m9cvQdhaC706soeXg.name: Alternate Benefit
m9cvQdhaC706soeXg.notes: Bonus to resist deception involving numbers

features.situation: from engineers and scientists
from audiences and critics

mSVPPQqkn1Wg1ZKyM.name: Alternate Benefit
mSVPPQqkn1Wg1ZKyM.notes: Bonus to HT rolls to avoid harm from failure of covered skills

features.situation: from explorers and nature lovers
from con artists, politicians, salesmen, etc. – but only if you aren’t trying to manipulate them.

tJusm03XASEmePVLU.name: Teratophobia (Monsters)
tJusm03XASEmePVLU.notes: Any “unnatural” creature sets off this fear. You have -1 to -4 on the self-control roll if the monster seems very large or dangerous, or if there are a lot of them. Note that the definition of “monster” depends on experience. An American Indian would consider an elephant monstrous, while an African pygmy would not!

tXAOOm_5NKenasI4n.name: Thalassophobia (Oceans)
tXAOOm_5NKenasI4n.notes: You are afraid of any large body of water. Ocean travel, or even air travel over the ocean, is basically impossible for you, and encounters with aquatic monsters are also upsetting.

tu0KYjUBLw84B4gKc.name: Trickster
tu0KYjUBLw84B4gKc.notes: Make a self-control roll each day. If you fail, you must try to trick a dangerous subject: a skilled warrior, a dangerous monster, a whole group of reasonably competent opponents, etc. If you resist, you get a cumulative -1 per day to your self-control roll until you finally fail a roll!

t2wSIEcRtmr3bOKTv.name: Triskaidekaphobia (Number 13)
t2wSIEcRtmr3bOKTv.notes: You must make a self-control roll whenever you have to deal with the number 13. Roll at -5 if Friday the 13th is involved!

tqyAIJKZUTPhxkhbU.name: Truthfulness
tqyAIJKZUTPhxkhbU.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you must keep silent about an uncomfortable truth (lying by omission). Roll at -5 if you actually have to tell a falsehood! If you fail, you blurt out the truth, or stumble so much that your lie is obvious.

tBkKPUWbn-oQUHCek.name: Tunnel Vision
tBkKPUWbn-oQUHCek.notes: Your arc of vision is a 60° wedge to the front. On a map, your only “front” hex is the one directly ahead of you. The hexes to either side of this are “side” hexes: you are at -2 to defend against attacks from these hexes, and can only attack into those hexes with a Wild Swing. Everything else is a “back” hex and get no defense against attacks originating from these hexes!

trClz3uZE-XIfFJKI.name: Unfazeable
trClz3uZE-XIfFJKI.notes: Exempt from fright checks. Reaction modifiers do not affect you.

tItKCGaV9UN_W1pVs.name: Unfit
tItKCGaV9UN_W1pVs.notes: You lose FP at twice the normal rate

features.situation: to all HT rolls to remain conscious, avoid death, resist disease or poison, etc

t9lxfCn84bo3idpX9.name: Unluckiness
t9lxfCn84bo3idpX9.notes: Once per play session, the GM will arbitrarily and maliciously make something go wrong for you.

tFHSoGWBDirlMO6Dd.name: Vampiric Bite
tFHSoGWBDirlMO6Dd.notes: Drains 1 HP + 1/level per second. For every 3 HP stolen, you heal 1 HP or 1 FP (your choice). Also lets you bite in combat without feeding. Add Teeth (Sharp Teeth) or Teeth (Sharp Beak) – your choice for free.

features.situation: on any task that requires creativity or invention, including most rolls against Artist skill and all Engineer rolls for new inventions
from followers of your deity
to interpret visions
to ST vs knockback

tOQfp3YosDgO4S3yI.name: Very Fit
tOQfp3YosDgO4S3yI.notes: Recover FP at twice the normal rate; lose FP at half the normal rate (in both cases, not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

features.situation: to all HT rolls to stay conscious, avoid death, resist disease, resist poison

tAonFRmR-RtLdMP8e.name: Very Rapid Healing
tAonFRmR-RtLdMP8e.notes: When you roll to recover lost HP, a successful HT roll means you heal 2 HP, not 1

features.situation: to effective HT when rolling to recover lost HP or to see if you can get over a crippling injury

t5g6bNO5HiThCJ7_D.name: Very Unfit
t5g6bNO5HiThCJ7_D.notes: You lose FP at twice the normal rate and recover FP at only half the normal rate

features.situation: -2 to all HT rolls to remain conscious, avoid death, resist disease or poison, etc.
from others who can hear your voice
from others who realize you are a weirdness magnet (except parapsychologists, cultists, conspiracy theorists, thrill-seekers)

mlTDPKZ4sC-AeKIzM.name: Game Time
mlTDPKZ4sC-AeKIzM.notes: Uses per game week equal to its maximum possible uses per session

tretZ6xRq46CLvbPu.name: Xenophobia (Strange and Unknown Things)
tretZ6xRq46CLvbPu.notes: You are upset by any sort of strange circumstances, and in particular by strange people. Make a self-control roll when surrounded by people of another race or nationality; roll at -3 if the people are not human. If you lose control, you might well attack strangers out of fear.
